node.title: The global economic recovery has been fast but uneven, a new report shows.
node.description: The organization predicted the global economy would grow 5.6 percent this year, but said a new virus-related downturn would hurt the United States and Europe differently.

node.title: Cutting a Banksy Into 10,000 (Digital) Pieces
node.description: A former Christie’s executive has joined cryptocurrency experts to create a company that purchases art and sells the fragments as NFTs.

node.title: The Michigan shooting was the deadliest on school property in the U.S. this year.
node.description: The rampage at Oxford High School was the deadliest shooting on school property in 2021, according to Education Week, which tracks such shootings in the U.S.

node.title: Nigeria is the latest African country to detect the Omicron variant.
node.description: The West African country reported at least three cases in recent travelers. It also initially said it had found an Omicron case from October, a statement it later withdrew.

node.title: Spotify Wrapped 2021 Will Send Out Shopping Links to Your Favorite Artists' Merch Pages
node.description: With this year's Spotify Wrapped, fans will be sent links to virtual merch tables for their favorite artists, where they can buy t-shirts, vinyl records and more.

node.title: Russia Orders U.S. Diplomats in Country for Over 3 Years to Leave By January 31
node.description: The Kremlin said the move is a response to a U.S. announcement that 27 Russian diplomats and their families would have to leave by January 30.

node.title: South Korea's 5 Omicron Cases All Connected to Travel to Nigeria
node.description: Three remaining cases are connected to a couple who traveled from Nigeria to South Korea on November 24, and their friend who picked them up from the airport and drove them home.

node.title: Putin Wants NATO Not to Deploy Weapons Near Russian Territory, Resist Eastern Expansion
node.description: Ukraine and the West have grown concerned about a Russian troop buildup near Ukraine's border and a potential invasion into the neighboring nation.

node.title: Crowds Gather Outside Supreme Court As Future of Roe v. Wade on the Line
node.description: The court is set to hear arguments in a case seeking to revive a 2018 Mississippi law that bans most abortions after 15 weeks of pregnancy.

node.title: Deer Breaks Into Woman's House and Bleeds Everywhere, Causing $40K Worth of Damage
node.description: The deer left a trail of destruction around the house which was compared to a "murder scene."

node.title: 'Significant momentum': How some super funds become more profitable by investing sustainably
node.description: A new study shows Australian superannuation funds that invest responsibly are becoming increasingly profitable than traditional funds. But some analyst says they need to be more transparent.

node.title: Texas resident gets over $4,000 in bills after COVID test
node.description: Although COVID-19 testing costs are supposed to be covered under most circumstances, some people have been getting large and confusing bills, including some for hundreds or thousands of dollars.

node.title: With Armory Show, the World Is Catching Up to Carrie Mae Weems
node.description: “The Shape of Things” confronts current issues of identity and injustice that the artist has been exploring throughout her 40-year career.

node.title: Viability has shifted slightly as medicine has advanced.
node.description: By Pam Belluck

node.title: Watch Livestream of Recently Discovered Comet Sharing Sky With Star Cluster
node.description: The comet, named C/2021 A1 Leonard, will pass Earth for the first time in around 70,000 years in what's promised to be a "breathtaking" sight.

node.title: Japan Tells Airlines to Stop Selling Seats on International Flights Until End of Year
node.description: The new measure is the latest in the country's attempts to curb transmission of the COVID-19 Omicron variant.

node.title: Sotomayor Suggests Overturning Roe Would Cause SCOTUS Decisions to Appear Political
node.description: "Will this institution survive the stench that this creates in the public perception?" the justice asked about Mississippi's efforts to overturn Roe v. Wade.

node.title: Biden offers words of encouragement to young girl with stutter
node.description: President Biden, who has a stutter, offered the girl a copy of one of his speeches that is marked up with his notes to help her in handling her own stutter.

node.title: Labs across U.S. test for COVID Omicron variant
node.description: The U.S. is sequencing 80,000 positive PCR tests per week to test for variants and learn how fast the variant is spreading — and how infectious it is.

node.title: W.H.O. members agree to begin talks on a global pandemic treaty.
node.description: They agreed to set up an intergovernmental negotiating body that is to meet no later than March to begin negotiating an international agreement intended to ensure a more coherent and equitable response to future pandemics.

node.title: Spotify Lead On How Artist Wrapped Has Grown From a Simple Email to a 'Global Phenomenon'
node.description: In an exclusive interview with Newsweek, Spotify Project Lead, Brendan Codey, explained how the Artist Wrapped feature has evolved into a "global phenomenon".

node.title: Fitness Enthusiast Who Died of COVID Didn't Want to Be 'Guinea Pig' With Vaccine
node.description: Before he went on a ventilator, John Eyers was reportedly "beating himself up" over not getting vaccinated.

node.title: Operation Ironside nets 18 more suspects as police seize guns and drugs
node.description: The latest arrests come amid a wave of SA Police raids across Adelaide, with guns seized and six properties searched in relation to what police described as drug trafficking and money laundering activities.

node.title: Gen Z Pop Stars Made Their Mark in 2021. Beware, Millennial Forebears.
node.description: Upstarts including Olivia Rodrigo, Lil Nas X, Chloe Bailey and the Kid Laroi grew up on the internet, admiring the artists who are now their contemporaries.

node.title: 6 Big Beatles Moments
node.description: The best way to watch “The Beatles: Get Back” is to take in as much in one go as possible, but if you don’t have seven-plus hours, here’s a guide to its eye-opening scenes.

node.title: ‘Stare decisis’ is likely to be much discussed in the abortion case. Here’s what it means.
node.description: By Charlie Savage

node.title: Protests Grow Outside Supreme Court Ahead of Mississippi Abortion Rights Case
node.description: Protesters from the Women's March organization, a pro-abortion rights group, and the March for Life organization were outside the Supreme Court on Wednesday.

node.title: How Beto O'Rourke Can Beat Greg Abbott in Texas
node.description: Experts suggested that rather than switching to the Democratic candidate, those who said they'd back Matthew McConaughey will now not turn up to vote.

node.title: Lauren Boebert Faces Ethics Complaint From Muslim, Jewish Groups Over Ilhan Omar Comments
node.description: "Rep. Boebert's hateful, anti-Muslim statements pose real-life dangers," said Muslim Advocates and Bend the Arc: Jewish Action.

node.title: Gov. Charlie Baker of Massachusetts Is Said to Decline a Re-election Bid
node.description: Mr. Baker, a moderate Republican in a deep-blue state, faced a Trump-backed primary challenge and a potentially difficult general election.
